items.name: Component_Viewport
items.content: # =================================================================== # # Script: Component_Viewport # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class Component_Viewport extends gs.Component_Visual ###* * A viewport component can contain multiple graphic objects and will automatically * clip them if they move out of the viewport-rectangle. The area of a viewport * can also be tinted or colored. So to tint the whole for example, it enough * to create a viewport taking the whole screen-space and then setting the * tone or color property. * * @module gs * @class Component_Viewport * @extends gs.Component_Visual * @memberof gs * @constructor * @param {Viewport} [viewport=null] - A native viewport object used by the component. If null, the component create a new one. ### constructor: (viewport) -> super() ###* * The native viewport-object. * @property viewport * @type gs.Viewport * @protected ### @viewport = viewport ###* * The visibility. If false the viewport and associated graphic objects are not rendered. * @property viewport * @type gs.Viewport * @protected ### @visible = yes @scroll = new gs.Point(0, 0) ###* * Sets up the viewport. * @method setup ### setup: -> if !@viewport @viewport = new gs.Viewport(0, 0, Graphics.width, Graphics.height) @isSetup = yes ###* * Disposes the viewport and all associated graphic objects. * @method dispose ### dispose: -> @viewport.dispose() ###* * Updates the origin-point of the game object. * @method updateOrigin ### updateOrigin: -> ###* * Updates the padding. * @method updatePadding ### updatePadding: -> if @object.padding? @viewport.rect.x += @object.padding.left @viewport.rect.y += @object.padding.top @viewport.rect.width -= @object.padding.left+@object.padding.right @viewport.rect.height -= @object.padding.bottom+@object.padding.bottom ###* * Updates the sprite properties from the game object properties. * @method update ### updateProperties: -> @viewport.rect.x = @object.dstRect.x @viewport.rect.y = @object.dstRect.y @viewport.rect.width = @object.dstRect.width @viewport.rect.height = @object.dstRect.height @viewport.ox = @scroll.x + @object.offset.x @viewport.oy = @scroll.y + @object.offset.y @viewport.anchor.x = @object.anchor.x @viewport.anchor.y = @object.anchor.y @viewport.zoomX = @object.zoom.x @viewport.zoomY = @object.zoom.y @viewport.angle = @object.angle @viewport.z = (@object.zIndex || 0) + (if !@object.parent then 0 else @object.parent.zIndex || 0) ###* * Updates the optional sprite properties from the game object properties. * @method updateOptionalProperties ### updateOptionalProperties: -> if @object.tone? @viewport.tone = @object.tone if @object.color? @viewport.color = @object.color if @object.effects? @viewport.effects = @object.effects if @object.parent?.visible_? @viewport.visible = @object.visible else if @object.parent?.visible? @viewport.visible = @object.visible else @viewport.visible = @object.visible ###* * Updates the viewport. * @method update ### update: -> super @setup() if not @isSetup @viewport.update() @updatePadding() @updateProperties() @updateOptionalProperties() gs.Component_Viewport = Component_Viewport
